content.summary: This section outlines the procedures for serving legal documents on non-resident investment advisers, general partners, and managing agents. It specifies how service can be made through appointed agents and the role of the Commission's Secretary in forwarding documents. It also provides definitions for terms like 'managing agent', 'non-resident', and 'principal office and place of business'.

elements.statement: A person may serve a non-resident investment adviser, non-resident general partner, or non-resident managing agent by furnishing the Commission with one copy of the process, pleadings, or papers, for each named party, and one additional copy for the Commission's records.

If process, pleadings, or other papers are served on the Commission as described in this section, the Secretary of the Commission (Secretary) will promptly forward a copy to each named party by registered or certified mail at that party's last address filed with the Commission.

terms.term: Last address filed with the Commission

elements.statement: If the Secretary certifies that the Commission was served with process, pleadings, or other papers pursuant to paragraph (a)(1) of this section and forwarded these documents to a named party pursuant to paragraph (a)(2) of this section, this certification constitutes evidence of service upon that party.

Managing agent means any person, including a trustee, who directs or manages, or who participates in directing or managing, the affairs of any unincorporated organization or association other than a partnership.
Non-resident means an individual who resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
Non-resident means a corporation that is incorporated in or that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.

Non-resident means a partnership or other unincorporated organization or association that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
Principal office and place of business has the same meaning as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.

content.summary: This section outlines the procedure for proceedings initiated by the filing of an application or by the Commission's own motion under any section of the Act or related rules. It details the publication of notice in the Federal Register, the process for interested persons to submit facts or request a hearing, and the conditions under which the Commission will order a hearing. It also defines 'application' for the purposes of this rule.

elements.statement: Notice of the initiation of the proceeding will be published in the Federal Register and will indicate the earliest date upon which an order disposing of the matter may be entered.

Any interested person may, within the period of time specified therein, submit to the Commission in writing any facts bearing upon the desirability of a hearing on the matter and may request that a hearing be held, stating his reasons therefor and the nature of his interest in the matter.

An order disposing of the matter will be issued as of course following the expiration of the period of time referred to in paragraph (a) of this section, unless the Commission thereafter orders a hearing on the matter.

The Commission will order a hearing on the matter, if it appears that a hearing is necessary or appropriate in the public interest or for the protection of investors, upon the request of any interested person or upon its own motion.
An 'application' means any application for an order of the Commission under the Act other than an application for registration as an investment adviser.

content.summary: This document defines what constitutes a 'small business' or 'small organization' under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 for the purposes of the Regulatory Flexibility Act. It specifies criteria related to assets under management, total assets, and control relationships to determine if an investment adviser qualifies as a small entity. It also provides definitions for 'control' and 'total assets' in this context.

elements.statement: An investment adviser has assets under management of less than $25 million.
An investment adviser did not have total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year.

terms.term: Last day of the most recent fiscal year

elements.statement: An investment adviser does not control, is not controlled by, and is not under common control with another investment adviser that has assets under management of $25 million or more.
verb_symbols: is not under common control with

elements.statement: Control means the power, directly or indirectly, to direct the management or policies of a person.
A person is presumed to control a corporation if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the corporation's voting securities.

terms.term: Class of the corporation's voting securities

elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a partnership if the person has the right to receive upon dissolution, or has contributed, 25 percent or more of the capital of the partnership.

terms.term: 25 percent or more of the capital

elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a limited liability company (LLC) if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the interests of the LLC.

terms.term: Class of the interests of the LLC

elements.statement: A person is presumed to control a trust if the person is a trustee or managing agent of the trust.

A person may serve a non-resident investment adviser, non-resident general partner, or non-resident managing agent by furnishing the Commission with one copy of the process, pleadings, or papers, for each named party, and one additional copy for the Commission's records.
content.transformed: A person may serve a non-resident investment adviser, non-resident general partner, or non-resident managing agent only if that person furnishes the Commission with one copy of the process, pleadings, or papers, for each named party, and one additional copy for the Commission's records.

content.statement: If process, pleadings, or other papers are served on the Commission as described in this section, the Secretary of the Commission (Secretary) will promptly forward a copy to each named party by registered or certified mail at that party's last address filed with the Commission.
content.transformed: Each Secretary of the Commission must forward a copy to each named party by registered or certified mail at that party's last address filed with the Commission if process, pleadings, or other papers are served on the Commission as described in this section.

content.statement: If the Secretary certifies that the Commission was served with process, pleadings, or other papers pursuant to paragraph (a)(1) of this section and forwarded these documents to a named party pursuant to paragraph (a)(2) of this section, this certification constitutes evidence of service upon that party.
content.transformed: The combination of process, pleadings, or other papers specified in each certification must be such that the Secretary certifies that the Commission was served with these documents and forwarded them to a named party if this certification constitutes evidence of service upon that party.

content.statement: Notice of the initiation of the proceeding will be published in the Federal Register and will indicate the earliest date upon which an order disposing of the matter may be entered.
content.transformed: A notice of the initiation of the proceeding must be published in the Federal Register and will indicate the earliest date upon which an order disposing of the matter may be entered.

content.statement: Any interested person may, within the period of time specified therein, submit to the Commission in writing any facts bearing upon the desirability of a hearing on the matter and may request that a hearing be held, stating his reasons therefor and the nature of his interest in the matter.
content.transformed: An interested person may submit to the Commission in writing any facts bearing upon the desirability of a hearing on the matter only if the period of time specified therein is met.

content.statement: An order disposing of the matter will be issued as of course following the expiration of the period of time referred to in paragraph (a) of this section, unless the Commission thereafter orders a hearing on the matter.
content.transformed: An order disposing of the matter may be issued only after the expiration of the period of time referred to in paragraph (a) of this section if the Commission does not thereafter order a hearing on the matter.

content.statement: The Commission will order a hearing on the matter, if it appears that a hearing is necessary or appropriate in the public interest or for the protection of investors, upon the request of any interested person or upon its own motion.
content.transformed: The Commission must order a hearing on the matter if it appears that a hearing is necessary or appropriate in the public interest or for the protection of investors, upon the request of any interested person or upon its own motion.

content.statement: Non-resident means an individual, corporation, partnership, or other unincorporated organization or association that resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
content.transformed: A non-resident is by definition an individual, a corporation, a partnership, or an unincorporated organization or association.

content.statement: An individual who resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States is considered a non-resident.
content.transformed: An individual is by definition a non-resident who resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.

content.statement: Non-resident means an individual, corporation, partnership, or other unincorporated organization or association that resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
content.transformed: A non-resident is by definition an individual, a corporation, a partnership, or an unincorporated organization or association that resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.

content.statement: A corporation that is incorporated in or that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States is considered a non-resident.
content.transformed: A corporation is by definition a non-resident that is incorporated in or that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.

content.statement: Principal office and place of business has the same meaning as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.
content.transformed: A principal office and place of business is by definition the same as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.

content.statement: Principal office and place of business has the same meaning as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.
content.transformed: A principal office and place of business is by definition the same as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.

content.statement: Non-resident means an individual, corporation, partnership, or other unincorporated organization or association that resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
content.transformed: A non-resident is by definition an individual, a corporation, a partnership, or an unincorporated organization or association that resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.

content.statement: A partnership that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States is considered a non-resident.
content.transformed: A partnership is by definition a non-resident that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.

content.statement: An unincorporated organization that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States is considered a non-resident.
content.transformed: An unincorporated organization is by definition a non-resident that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.

content.statement: An association that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States is considered a non-resident.
content.transformed: An association is by definition a non-resident that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.

content.statement: Principal office and place of business has the same meaning as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.
content.transformed: A principal office and place of business is by definition the same as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.

content.statement: Principal office and place of business has the same meaning as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.
content.transformed: A place of business is by definition the same as the principal office and place of business as defined in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.

content.statement: Principal office and place of business has the same meaning as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.
content.transformed: A principal office and place of business is by definition the same as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.

content.statement: Principal office and place of business has the same meaning as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.
content.transformed: A principal office and place of business is by definition the same as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.

content.statement: Notice of the initiation of the proceeding will be published in the Federal Register and will indicate the earliest date upon which an order disposing of the matter may be entered.
content.transformed: A notice of the initiation of the proceeding is by definition a notice that will be published in the Federal Register and will indicate the earliest date upon which an order disposing of the matter may be entered.

content.statement: An 'application' means any application for an order of the Commission under the Act other than an application for registration as an investment adviser.
content.transformed: An application is by definition an application for an order of the Commission under the Act other than an application for registration as an investment adviser.

content.statement: Assets under management, as defined under Section 203A(a)(3) of the Act (15 U.S.C. 80b-3a(a)(2)) and reported on its annual updating amendment to Form ADV (17 CFR 279.1).
content.transformed: Assets under management is by definition the assets that are defined under Section 203A(a)(3) of the Act (15 U.S.C. 80b-3a(a)(2)) and reported on its annual updating amendment to Form ADV (17 CFR 279.1).

content.statement: The total assets as shown on the balance sheet of the investment adviser or other person described above under paragraph (a)(3) of this section, or the balance sheet of the investment adviser or such other person with its subsidiaries consolidated, whichever is larger.
content.transformed: Total assets is by definition the larger of the balance sheet of the investment adviser or other person described above under paragraph (a)(3) of this section, or the balance sheet of the investment adviser or such other person with its subsidiaries consolidated.

content.statement: The power, directly or indirectly, to direct the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise.
content.transformed: Control is by definition the power that directly or indirectly directs the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise.

content.statement: Assets under management, as defined under Section 203A(a)(3) of the Act (15 U.S.C. 80b-3a(a)(2)) and reported on its annual updating amendment to Form ADV (17 CFR 279.1).
content.transformed: Assets under management is by definition the assets that are defined under Section 203A(a)(3) of the Act (15 U.S.C. 80b-3a(a)(2)) and reported on its annual updating amendment to Form ADV (17 CFR 279.1).

content.statement: The power, directly or indirectly, to direct the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise.
content.transformed: Control is by definition the power that directly or indirectly directs the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise.

content.statement: The Commission refers to the entity to which process, pleadings, or other papers are served for non-resident investment advisers, general partners, and managing agents.
content.transformed: A Commission is by definition an entity that refers to the entity to which process, pleadings, or other papers are served for non-resident investment advisers, general partners, and managing agents.

content.statement: The Commission refers to the entity to which process, pleadings, or other papers are served for non-resident investment advisers, general partners, and managing agents.
content.transformed: A Commission is by definition the entity to which process, pleadings, or other papers are served for non-resident investment advisers, general partners, and managing agents.

content.statement: The Secretary of the Commission (Secretary) will promptly forward a copy to each named party by registered or certified mail at that party's last address filed with the Commission.
content.transformed: A Secretary of the Commission will promptly forward by definition at most one copy to each named party by registered or certified mail at that party's last address filed with the Commission.

content.statement: The Secretary of the Commission (Secretary) will promptly forward a copy to each named party by registered or certified mail at that party's last address filed with the Commission.
content.transformed: A Secretary of the Commission promptly forwards by definition exactly one copy to each named party by registered or certified mail at that party's last address filed with the Commission.

content.statement: The Commission refers to the entity to which process, pleadings, or other papers are served for non-resident investment advisers, general partners, and managing agents.
content.transformed: A Commission is by definition an entity to which process, pleadings, or other papers are served for non-resident investment advisers, general partners, and managing agents.
